issue.title: drive: multiple files of same name being created

milestone.title: Known Problem
milestone.description: This milestone contains issues which are known problems which are proving difficult to fix, or are awaiting an external fix or we haven't got round to yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Great tool! Thanks for all your work on this and making it available. 

Using `rclone sync` to a drive location, I'm seeing many copies of the same file/same name being created. Saw in the release notes that this was a fix in 1.06, but I've only ever used versions 1.07 and 1.09 (just downloaded 1.10 and will try that as well). 

Possible causes include: 
- interrupted transfers? (it's a huge directory and hasn't finished)
- maybe the deletions only occur after a sync is successful/complete?

Any thoughts?

....
The second attempt worked ;-)

@madralphw I'm currently testing a fix for this which is looking encouraging.  If you want to try a test binary, then drop me an email to nick@craig-wood.com  with your platform (windows/linux 32/64 bit) and I'll send you one.

I've fixed this in rcone v1.12 which you can download from rclone.org

It switches to chunked mode for uploading big files which should make big file uploading much more reliable, and mean you won't get the auth problems any more.

Please re-open this ticket if you see the auth problem again.

Thanks for the report

Nick

issue.title: drive: authError when uploading big files

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hello,

I noticed #33 has been closed with a fix posted in version 1.12. However I'm using 1.16 and getting the same error on large files as of today:

2015/06/16 03:52:27 TRANSFERS/C$/Users/*****/Documents/Outlook Files/Archive.pst: Failed to copy: googleapi: Error 401: Invalid Credentials, authError

The file in question is 15GB in size.

Any other suggestions to resolve this would be appreciated!

Thanks,
Max

issue.title: SugarSync broke for me in release 1.56.0

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you are reporting a bug or asking for a new feature then please use one of the templates here:

    https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/new

otherwise fill in the form below.

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->


#### Output of `rclone version`
```
rclone v1.56.0
- os/version: ubuntu 20.04 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 5.4.0-80-generic (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.16.5
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
```


#### Describe the issue
Trying to set up rclone for a SugarSync remote on my Linux box (Ubuntu 20.04 64-bit).  
Running `rclone config` and selecting SugarSync (# 33 in 1.56.0) and accepting all defaults and supplying my sugarsync username (email) and password when prompted results in an error message 
`Error: failed to get token: HTTP error 401 (401 Unauthorized)`

I created a new question on the forum here....
[https://forum.rclone.org/t/trouble-getting-sugarsync-remote-configured/25864](url)

A very helpful person finally confirmed that a sugarsync remote could not be created successfully using rclone 1.56.0 but when rclone was rolled back to 1.55.1, then a sugarsync remote could be created successfully.  I have not independently confirmed this result yet but plan to as soon as I can figure out how to roll back my rclone.
